name: GetIncidentResponseAnalytics
description:
Provides enriched responder data for a single incident.

Use this tool to obtain detailed analytics on a specific incident's responder data, such as Time to Respond, Responder Type, and Response Status. Note that analytics data is updated daily and may take up to 24 hours to appear.

parameters.name: incident_id
parameters.description: The ID of the incident to retrieve analytics for.

parameters.name: accept_version_header
parameters.description: Specify the versioning header for the API request. This defines the response format version.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type
parameters.description: Specifies the media type of the resource. Use 'application/json'.

parameters.name: results_limit
parameters.description: The number of results to include in each batch. Acceptable values range from 1 to 1000.

value_schema.description:
Number of results to include in each batch.
Limits between 1 to 1000 are accepted.

parameters.name: display_order
parameters.description: Specifies the order to display results: 'asc' for ascending, 'desc' for descending. Defaults to 'desc'.

value_schema.description: The order in which to display the results; asc for ascending, desc for descending. Defaults to `desc`.

parameters.name: order_results_by_column
parameters.description: Specify the column to use for ordering the results, such as 'requested_at'.

value_schema.description: The column to use for ordering the results.

parameters.name: time_zone_for_results
parameters.description: The time zone to use for displaying the results.

value_schema.description: The time zone to use for the results.
